content:
Congratulations on the sales and the interest from the local boutique owner!

Tracking interactions with potential wholesale customers is a great idea, and a separate sheet can help you stay organized and focused on building those relationships. You can create a "Wholesale Leads" or "Potential Partners" sheet to keep track of:

* Contact information: name, email, phone number, store name, etc.
* Initial contact date and method (e.g., Spring Fling Market)
* Notes on conversations or meetings, including dates and topics discussed
* Follow-up tasks and deadlines (e.g., sending product samples or proposals)
* Status updates (e.g., interested, pending, declined)

This sheet can help you:

* Keep track of multiple leads and conversations simultaneously
* Remember important details and follow-up tasks
* Analyze the progress and potential of each lead
* Identify patterns or areas for improvement in your outreach efforts

You can also consider adding columns to track:

* Product interest: which specific products they're interested in, and in what quantities
* Pricing and terms: any discussions or agreements on wholesale pricing, payment terms, or other logistical details
* Next steps: what you need to do to move the conversation forward (e.g., send a contract, provide product samples)

Having a dedicated sheet for wholesale leads will help you stay organized, focused, and proactive in building relationships with potential partners. Good luck with your follow-up with the boutique owner, and I hope it leads to a successful partnership!
